alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Indian River; Martin; Northern Brevard County; Southern Brevard County; St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued January 08 at 2:02AM EST until January 09 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM EST THIS MORNING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Numerous strong, potentially life threatening rip currents and rough surf conditions expected.. * WHERE...Southern Brevard, Indian River, St. Lucie, Martin, Coastal Volusia and Northern Brevard Counties. * WHEN...From 6 AM EST this morning through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. Entering the surf is strongly discouraged due to the dangerous surf and rip current conditions.
info.instruction: Rip currents are powerful channels of water flowing quickly away from shore, which occur most often at low spots or breaks in the sandbar and in the vicinity of structures such as jetties and piers. Heed the advice of lifeguards, beach patrol flags and signs.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Volusia; Indian River; Martin; Northern Brevard County; Southern Brevard County; St. Lucie
